borough: London Borough of Hammersmith and Fulham
description: In western rear garden areaT1-Large Elder(Sambucus nigra)-multiple stems leaning heavily inbound shading nursing home rooms, potential danger of failure-section fell to ground levelT2-XL Bay(Laurus nobilis)-3x stems-section fell to ground levelT3-XL Bay(Laurus nobilis)-4x stems-section fell to ground levelT4-Lilac(Syringa)-reduce all stems to retain 2.2 m above the ground levelIn compound area on south boundaryT5-Sycamore(Acer pseudoplatanus)-self-set tall phototropic-section fell to ground level using rigging to safely lower branch sections to ground level where necessary -poison stump using EcoPlug capsules inserted into stump wood to prevent sucker regrowthT6-Elder(Sambucus nigra)-section fell to ground level-poison stump using EcoPlug capsules inserted into stump wood to prevent sucker regrowthT7-Elder(Sambucus nigra)-section fell to ground level-poison stump using EcoPlug capsules inserted into stump wood to prevent sucker regrowthReasons for works: T1 - Tree has become dangerous and has potential to fail; T2 & T3 - both trees have outgrown space.T4 - all works are for routine maintenance; T5 - tree is self set and has outgrown space and potential damage to outhouse.T6 - tree has potential to damage brick outhouse; T7 - Self set and outgrown space
application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
